meanings.sent1: The restaurant was overstaffed with too many waiters standing around.
meanings.sent2: The company became overstaffed after hiring extra employees during the busy season.
meanings.sent3: It was comical how overstaffed the tiny store was with three cashiers at the checkout counter.
meanings.sent4: The meeting felt overstaffed with so many people crowded into the small conference room.
meanings.sent5: The classroom seemed overstaffed with three teachers trying to teach the same lesson.

meanings.definition: Having an excessive number of employees.
meanings.sent1: The overstaffed department struggled to find work for all its employees.
meanings.sent2: The store became overstaffed when they hired too many workers for the slow season.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see how overstaffed the movie set was with actors waiting around for their scenes.
meanings.sent4: The team felt overstaffed with players all trying to compete for the same position.
meanings.sent5: The office seemed overstaffed with employees constantly bumping into each other in the narrow hallways.
